name: WHILE
description: This is a process control command, i.e., it will control whether a command, or group of commands will be executed. This is one part of a complete command structure.

parameters.name: expression
parameters.description: expression - lexpr - Required - If the expression resolves to .T., the command lines between the WHILE command and the next LOOP_IF, EXIT, EXIT_IF or ENDW (Endwhile) command will be executed.

comments: For more information on the different structured programming commands, and the WHILE command in particular, please see Chapter 7, Structured Programming Commands.
